pageContext.claim: “I am such a smart guy. I said this is the most brilliant thing ever and I went back to my people and I said, you know, I have an idea. If veterans are sick, they can't get the kind of service they need or they need a certain kind of a doctor. I have an idea. It's such a great idea. You're going to go out private. You're going to pick up a doctor. You're going to get yourself fixed up. We're going to pay the bill, right? And you know what happened? And I said how, how brilliant is that? They say, sir, we've been working on that for 48 years, but we've never been able to get it approved.”
pageContext.analysis: Not only does Trump falsely claim this could never be approved -- he only signed an updated version of a law signed by President Barack Obama -- but he invents a story about how Veterans Choice was all his idea. (The insertion of "sir" is often a sign this is an invented tale.)
